<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.

<target_code>
Here is the code of connection_add_header:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
connection_add_header (void *cls,
                       const char *key,
                       size_t key_size,
                       const char *value,
                       size_t value_size,
                       enum MHD_ValueKind kind)
{
  struct MHD_Connection *connection = (struct MHD_Connection *) cls;
  if (MHD_NO ==
      MHD_set_connection_value_n (connection,
                                  kind,
                                  key,
                                  key_size,
                                  value,
                                  value_size))
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              _ ("Not enough memory in pool to allocate header record!\n"));
#endif
    transmit_error_response_static (connection,
                                    MHD_HTTP_REQUEST_HEADER_FIELDS_TOO_LARGE,
                                    ERR_MSG_REQUEST_TOO_BIG);
    return MHD_NO;
  }
  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I found no uses of compiler-specific language extensions in the provided code fragment. Specifically checked and not present: 1) No GCC/Clang extensions such as __attribute__((...)), __builtin_* functions, __typeof__, statement-expression ({ ... }), nested functions, or __extension__ markers. 2) No inline assembly or __asm__ usage. 3) No compiler-specific keywords (for example __inline, __restrict, __cdecl, __stdcall, etc.). 4) No reliance on nonstandard preprocessor features beyond simple #ifdef/#endif. 5) No use of nonstandard cast forms — the cast from void * to struct MHD_Connection * is standard C. 6) No use of compiler-specific pragmas or platform-specific annotations. Therefore there are no fragments that appear to violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 in this code; nothing needs to be forwarded for investigation under this rule.
